monsters.Name: Aazerach
monsters.Bio: Aazerachs are demonic beings of pure magic that come from another world. Since they are able to freely cross the barrier between their world and ours, an occult summoning circle is necessary to trap them. Although Aazerachs seem to have eyes on their heads, they are actually blind. They detect living beings through some unknown supernatural sense.
monsters.History: According to the Blind Starseer's own writing, she was visited by an Aazerach when she was very young. The demon took her eyesight, but granted her the same supernatural sense that Aazerachs possess. Over time, it allowed her to gain the demonic knowledge that led to the creation of the Ahrimaaya, the tome of demons. According to her later writings, she spent many years trying to escape other Aazerachs that were hunting her. Supposedly, Aazerachs watch over our world and step in whenever humans come too close to finding out about the worlds around us.

monsters.Name: Akhlut
monsters.Bio: Once regarded as kings of the ocean and referred to as "killers of whales" by sailors. Beyond their status as an apex predator, they are also often reported to have a connection to the afterworld.
monsters.History: According to legend, when the humans of the Old World began to hunt seals and whales more excessively, there was less food in the oceans for the Akhlut. So the Akhlut began to walk on land and prey on the animals it found there - but mostly, the Akhlut preyed on humans. The human fishers and warriors tried to fight back, but none of their weapons had any effect on the Akhlut. And so it became the mission of the shamans to defeat these unstoppable predators. Using ancient rituals and spells, the shamans learned to link their spirits with the Akhlut and control them. The Akhlut no longer preyed on humans, and the shamans gained some of the powers of the Akhlut.

monsters.Name: Arachlich
monsters.Bio: Arachliches are highly intelligent undead Monsters that have attained immortality through sorcery. Their spell power is unequaled throughout the world, but they rarely use their full potential. Doing so would drain away their precious power that they have accumulated over centuries. Even while under the control of a Monster Keeper, Arachliches only use a fraction of their true power. Arachliches always maintain an unusual amount of free will. In fact, some fear that Arachliches merely pretend to be under their Keepers' control, following their Keepers for the opportunity to gain more power.
monsters.History: In 239 AC, a devious plot of a group of Arachliches was uncovered. The Arachliches had lured several Monster Keepers to the Sanctuary's Underworld, so that they could join their Monster teams. However, the Arachliches used forbidden magic to take over their Keepers' minds, plotting to use their Monster teams to take over the Sanctuary. Surprisingly, it wasn't other Monster Keepers who uncovered this plot; it was the other Monsters of those brain-washed Keepers. They noticed that their Keepers' behaviors had changed, and so they eventually realized what was going on. They rejected their Arachlich masters and defeated them.

monsters.Name: Argiope
monsters.Bio: Argiopes are giant spider-like Monsters with a distinctive exoskeleton that is made of silver. Because of their calculating and patient nature, Argiopes usually bide their time and wait for their prey to come to them. Argiopes spread tiny invisible threads throughout their territories that alert them of any trespasser. Once alerted, Argiopes will silently stalk their target and ambush them at just the right moment. They possess small wing-like limbs on their back, which allow them to redirect their jumps in mid-air. Thanks to this ability, as well as their excellent vision and split-second reactions, it's almost impossible to escape from an Argiope. If need be, Argiopes can also throw their webs like a net to immobilize their foes.
monsters.History: In the Old World, Argiopes were found in dense forests and open caves, far from human civilisation. Argiopes are able to foresee their prey's actions thanks to being attuned with the nature around them. Therefore, they are very sensitive to human interference, since it disrupts the natural processes of their surroundings. In the Sanctuary, Argiopes adapted to the gloomy atmosphere of the Underworld, since it's very rare for Monster Keepers to set foot there.

monsters.Name: Asura
monsters.Bio: Asuras are fierce, mythical beings that can have positive as well as negative qualities. Their depictions in art are a popular topic among scholars and priests. According to their interpretations, the many arms of Asuras signify that they may learn and master many different skills. Supposedly, their hands are always empty so that they may freely grasp at that which they don't have.
monsters.History: In the stories, Asuras are said to be the lesser relatives of gods. Through a life of piety, restraint, and good deeds, an Asura would ascend to true godhood. However, this clashes with the innate nature of Asuras, as they tend to be selfish, ambitious, and hot-headed. It is an Asura's highest goal to gain the power of a god, yet they may only gain it if they relinquish all desires. Many Asuras relish in the fact that they may never leave this earthly world, but they never stop envying the gods.

monsters.Name: Aurumtail
monsters.Bio: A curious mix of reptilian and canine physiology with a unique set of skills. In particular, the Aurumtail's ability to find precious ores and minerals is singular among the inhabitants of the Monster Sanctuary. This ability might have developed due to the Aurumtail's peculiar feeding habits: Its primary diet consists of Mana which it obtains from specific minerals found in caves and underground. This renders their body fragile to physical forces, but gives them an almost impenetrable resistance to magical influences.
monsters.History: The Aurumtail is loyal to its Keeper to a degree that sometimes proves tragic. When it was first discovered that this species had a knack for finding gemstones, many treasure seekers sought them out. However, removing them from their habitats which were rich in the Mana that they needed to survive proved fatal for many of the species. Since then, it has become a well-known fact that keeping an Aurumtail is a big responsibility that comes with certain challenges. However, a Keeper who is able to properly take care of the Aurumtail's needs is in turn rewarded with one of the most loyal and intelligent companions a Keeper can wish for.

monsters.Name: Beetloid
monsters.Bio: The Beetloid is quite a terrifying creature, which is why the Keepers try to keep their population low. Its horn and lower abdomen are mainly comprised of a unique type of metal called beetlium. The lower abdomen resembles an electromagnetic coil, consisting of many beetlium threads. It allows the Beetloid to charge and store a deadly amount of electricity, whereas the horn is used as a lightning rod to protect it from incoming lightning. A fight between two Beetloids in their prime is quite a sight to behold - if one lives to tell the tale.
monsters.History: It is unknown how the Beetloids came into being. However, it is peculiar that they emerged only after humanity had discovered electricity and begun industrialisation. The most popular theory states that the Beetloid is nature's response to humanity's advances in technology. A less popular theory states that a mad scientist created the Beetloids as living energy generators.

monsters.Name: Blade Widow
monsters.Bio: It is quite dangerous to come face to face with these mantis-like creatures, as they are known to prey on just about anything that stumbles into their territory. They are even known to feast on their own kind in certain situations. Almost all of the Blade Widows found in nature are female, as the males of the species are usually much smaller and their lifespans are quite limited. Once a Blade Widow's powerful eyes have found a target, the Blade Widow becomes utterly relentless.
monsters.History: Despite the Blade Widows' predatory nature, scholars and mystics have been fascinated with this creature since ancient times. Some even believed the Blade Widows to be earthly messengers or incarnations of a female god of war, and warriors sometimes gave sacrifices to the Blade Widows in hopes that it would grant them fortune in future battles. One particular myth states that, should a warrior die outside of battle, their soul would have to face off against a Blade Widow in the spirit realm. No matter how strong the warrior was in life, they cannot win this fight, for it only serves to test the warrior's spirit and to give them a warrior's death.

monsters.Name: Blob
monsters.Bio: Gelatinous, amorphous, transparent, semi-solid, slimy - Blobs. Many Keepers don't think much of them, but it should be noted that there were several high-ranking Monster Keepers in history who employed a Blob in their team of Monsters. Keeper Master Duncan even once called his Blob his "most trusty and steely companion", although it might have been in jest. It is tradition for the Monster Keepers of that family to manage a farm of blobs just west of the Keepers' Stronghold.
monsters.History: The Blobs were denizens of the Monster Sanctuary from the moment it was created. Curiously, there are no known stories of the Blob from the Old World. Could it be that the magic that was used to create the Sanctuary somehow also brought the Blobs into the world? Are they just a random by-product of the Sanctuary or is their existence linked to the nature of the Sanctuary? Nobody knows for sure as the scribes from that era didn't seem to assign the Blobs much importance. They took the Blobs for granted, and perhaps it is best for us to do the same. The notion of a hidden realm that is only inhabited by Blobs is generally seen as ridiculous by most Monster Keepers.

monsters.Name: Brawlish
monsters.Bio: Brawlish are burly, hot-tempered fish that spend a lot of their time outside of water, being able to breath through their skin. They use their powerful, muscular arms to move on land. Every adult Brawlish eventually digs a burrow above the water, which gives the Brawlish shelter during its sleep and helps it regulate its temperature. When the mating season arrives, both male and female Brawlish attempt to impress each other by performing push-ups, sit-ups, high jumps, backflips or even by lifting heavy objects.
monsters.History: There's a popular folktale of a fisherman accidentally catching a Brawlish with a hook on a line. Pulling it out of the water was difficult enough, but once the Brawlish got out of water, the real struggle began. In the following fight, the fisherman was badly bruised and beaten, but he was eventually able to land a knockout punch, incapacitating the Brawlish. He dragged the heavy fish all the way home and, once there, immediately began buttering and heating up the biggest pan that he could find. As soon as he dropped the Brawlish in the hot pan, it regained consciousness and completely wrecked the fisherman's home. It escaped to live another day.

monsters.Name: Brutus
monsters.Bio: When it comes to brute strength, no other Monster can rival a Brutus. What many don't know, however, is that they are also very intelligent. They can use tools, but they usually prefer to use their brawn to achieve their goals. They can also learn sign language, but they mostly just sign "Brutus strong" and "you lose". A newborn Brutus spends the first six to seven years of its life riding on its mother's back. Later, they set off on their own in the wilds to find their own territory to conquer.
monsters.History: It seemed to be an impossible task to convince the fully-grown Bruti of the Old World to give up their territories. A group of Keepers instead focussed on Bruti that were on the cusp of adulthood, when they would set out to find their own territory. The Keepers managed to lure the young Bruti to the Monster Sanctuary with the promise of many unconquered territories.

monsters.Name: Caraglow
monsters.Bio: Small, feline and fun-loving creatures that love to play around in the dark areas of the Monster Sanctuary. Many Keepers see the Caraglow as a sign of good luck while exploring dark caves. Caraglows happily guide lost Keepers out of caves and caverns, travelling ahead of them while carrying their lights by the handle in their mouths. Despite being friendly towards travellers and Keepers, a Caraglow is extremely protective of their burrow and will attempt to guide travellers away from it. Should that fail, the Caraglow will defend their burrow by attacking trespassers with its sharp claws.
monsters.History: The Caraglows are seen by many as one of the friendliest and most domesticable Monsters in the Monster Sanctuary, and many retired Keepers keep them as pets. It is advised for Keepers wishing to keep a Caraglow that they are provided with a room or area that is left dark, as Caraglows tend to get rowdy and destructive otherwise. However, once well-adjusted to the lighting of homes and outdoor environments, a Caraglow is as playful as they are in caves, and they make for great pets for children or lonely older individuals to take care of.

monsters.Name: Catzerker
monsters.Bio: These courageous feline creatures roam the mountains for wild beasts to slay. They originated from an ordinary kitten that set out to find its lost master.
monsters.History: They say that there once was a legendary knight by the name of Siegfried. He had put his blade down on a field of grass, when an ordinary kitten with gray fur came and sat upon the blade. Siegfried took the kitten as his pet and brought it to his keep, where the cat lounged many evenings before the hearth. Eventually, Siegfried rode out on an adventure from which he never returned. The cat missed its master and went to look for him. Eventually, it found Siegfried's blade, but there was no trace of the cat's valiant master. The cat sat upon the blade just as it had done so many years ago and waited eagerly for its master's return. After many days and nights had passed, the cat decided that it would bring the blade to its master. Cats are stubborn creatures, and so the cat learned to carry the sword with its paws. As it dragged the sword through the countryside, the cat's physique changed gradually until it became the first Catzerker. However, it never found its master in all of its nine lives.

monsters.Name: Changeling
monsters.Bio: Changelings are the ever-changing true shapeshifters of the Monster kingdom. Each Changeling contains the traits of every single Monster that is known to us. The matter that makes up their body is fluid and metallic at the same time, like liquid quicksilver, but it's also able to perfectly mimic biological structures and processes.
monsters.History: For a long time, it was believed that Changelings were simply born from the earth itself - but there is evidence that Changelings originated from the stars. All Changelings were once part of a single being, called the Proto-Changeling. It traveled through the empty void like a half-sentient, slumbering comet for many years. Thousands of years ago, it landed on our world, creating a substantial crater. Being a fluid, amorphous mass, it then slowly seeped underground, becoming part of the very lands and oceans of our world. Over the millenia, it absorbed the fallen remains of countless Monsters, gaining access to their traits in the process. Eventually, small parts of the Proto-Changeling gained sentience and dug their way through the earth to the world above, emerging as Changelings. Unconscious parts of the Proto-Changeling can still be found underground in some parts of the world.

monsters.Name: Crackle Knight
monsters.Bio: A living set of armor with the power of lightning, which is often found brooding in abandoned castle ruins. However, the Crackle Knight has no lack of personality, as there are many stories of the Crackle Knights' sense of honor and their noble nature. Once a Monster Keeper has earned the respect of a Crackle Knight, it is not uncommon for that Crackle Knight to make it its life goal to protect its master from all perils.
monsters.History: It is unknown how the Crackle Knights came into existence, although there are many stories and ballads from medieval times that feature them in prominent roles. In one of these stories, a group of bandits and renegade knights fled to a forest glade after ransacking a nearby village. Of course, they did not know of the legendary Knight Gawain who wielded the Sword of Lightning and who had made a solemn vow a century ago that these lands would forever be under his protection. As nightfall came, a rainstorm fell upon the bandits. Lightning struck the earth, and the Crackle Knight emerged from it. He challenged the bandits, and one by one, he exacted his revenge and felled them all.

monsters.Name: Crystal Snail
monsters.Bio: The most well-known resident of the crystal caves of Snowy Peaks. In fact, Crystal Snails are the source of the brilliant crystals found in those caves. Crystal Snails dig into the ground and consume the minerals that they find there, which allows them to grow the pristine crystals on their back. The crystals provide the Crystal Snails a protective cover from predators, but the Crystal Snails can also use them to fight back as well. Crystal Snails are completely deaf, so Keepers have to communicate with them in sign language.
monsters.History: As we know from numerous cave drawings and fossil finds, the Crystal Snails have existed since prehistoric times. Since they came into being so early in history, it is even theorized that they used to represent the apex species of this world. They lived and prospered in an age in which they were only rivalled by primal nature spirits such as Rocky. Perhaps it is because of them that so many other Monsters evolved - for the Crystal Snail can be an extremely invasive species that will consume most plant life in its habitat if left unhindered. Animals had to turn into monstrous beasts to fight back against the Crystal Snail.

monsters.Name: Darnation
monsters.Bio: The ruthless Darnation is a vicious predator that utilizes its hard exoskeleton and its uniquely adaptable offensive capabilities to secure its apex position. A Darnation is able to utilize chemical compounds within its body to produce multiple bizarre effects. It can coat its hook-like arms with a powerful corroding acid to eat away at its foe's defenses as well as swiftly dig through the earth. More surprisingly, a Darnation is also capable of producing volatile compounds that create powerful short range explosions, which often catch prey or would-be predators off-guard.
monsters.History: Discovery of the Darnations is accredited to a Monster Keeper known only as Verdestrom. The limited research conducted on Darnations by Verdestrom suggests that they are intelligent and highly adaptable. The physiology of the Darnation suggests that it is not native to the Sanctuary and perhaps not even to our planet. Legend has it that when Darnations originally arrived, they were much smaller and more docile creatures than they are now. Considering the caliber and conditions of Monsters found within its original habitat, however, it's not surprising that Darnations over time would grow and adapt to deal with such threats in order to survive.

monsters.Name: Diavola
monsters.Bio: Diavolae are plant-like predators of demonic origin. In its dormant state, it is usually found in the middle of an empty clearing, as no other plants, animals or Monsters would come close to it. It uses its appearance to lure unsuspecting explorers in. It is also capable, however, to shift into an active state by pulling its roots out of the ground and using them as limbs.
monsters.History: The first Diavola came to our world as a single seed. Being able to crawl during its seed stage similar to insect larvae, it attached itself to another, unknown demonic Monster that made the voyage to our world. In its seed stage, it's also capable of evolving into different plant-like shapes, and so it chose an appearance that resembles the plants of our world. It may have spread to many different worlds in the same manner.

monsters.Name: Dodo
monsters.Bio: Dodos are big, fluffy, earthbound birds with remarkably good-natured dispositions. Perhaps they once were capable of flight, but now their wings are mainly used by the adult Dodos to protect their chicks from harsh sunlight. Both the male and the female Dodo cooperate when it comes to incubating their eggs and rearing their young. It has even been seen in nature that a couple of Dodos would adopt an orphaned egg and happily treat it as their own.
monsters.History: Dodos were discovered on a small, remote island only a few years before the Monster Sanctuary was created. Their tropical island was like a carefree paradise to the Dodos since they were free of any predators there and had an abundance of food. Naturally, the trusting and naive Dodos and their eggs became easy prey to the explorers. The Dodos very quickly had to learn how to defend themselves to escape extinction. Thankfully, they were aided by a group of people who later went on to become the first Monster Keepers when the Sanctuary was created. In the war between the Sanctuary and the Old World, the Dodos served faithfully as mounts for the Monster Keepers.

monsters.Name: Dracogran
monsters.Bio: When one studies the Dracograns, it becomes obvious very quickly that these are hot-blooded reptiles - in fact, their blood would burn through most materials known to us. Dracograns are also known for their pride, as they only accept Keepers in charge of them who have proven themselves.
monsters.History: When the Dragon Empress was of age, she joined the rebels who were fighting against the usurper who had taken the throne - still unaware of her royal heritage. However, there was a betrayer among her group who sold them out. The rebels were imprisoned in the usurper's dungeon, while the Empress's Draconov was put in an enchanted cage, put on display in the usurper's throne room. The cage was resistant to the Draconov's claws and its fire. When the Empress was brought out to be executed, the Draconov cried so loudly that it could be heard all across the town. Suddenly, the sky blackened as if the sun had been blotted out - a host of Dracograns had arrived. They rescued the Empress with mighty dragonfire. On that day, it became clear that she was the rightful heir to the throne.

monsters.Name: Draconoir
monsters.Bio: Draconoirs are one of the more elusive evolutionary paths of the Draconov. From among the Draco family, Draconoirs are blessed with highest wisdom and longevity. However, they only share their wisdom with those who are very wise themselves.
monsters.History: From one day to another, the Dragon Empress was crowned queen. She used her army of Dracograns to conquer more than half of the Old World, no force in the world able to oppose her. However, the story takes a strange turn when, on her 33rd birthday, the Dragon Empress and her entire castle vanished into thin air. Her loyal order of dragoons spent many years looking for her, but all they could find was the Empress's Draconov. Eventually, they all had to come to terms with their queen's sudden disappearance and the end of the reign of dragons. From sheer grief, the Draconov evolved into a large Draconoir, and it terrorized the lands of the Old World for decades.

monsters.Name: Draconov
monsters.Bio: Draconovs are the whelps of the Draco family of Monsters. Nonetheless, they are fierce dragons in their own right - all it takes to unlock their full potential is a wise Keeper. Unlike their evolved forms, Draconovs will never judge their Keepers if they show signs of insecurity or weakness.
monsters.History: The story of the Dragon Empress is widely known throughout the entire world. She was the rightful heir of a regal bloodline, but her parents fell to a bloody coup, initiated by a usurper whose name was erased from history. Before her parents died, they had their daughter sent away to an unassuming farmstead, where she grew up without knowing about her true heritage. When she turned three, a robed stranger arrived at the farmstead. He gave her foster parents an egg and told them to always keep it nearby the girl's bed. He left as abruptly as he had appeared. Her foster parents were puzzled by the man's words, but they heeded his words. When the girl turned seven, a Draconov hatched from the egg. Her parents were terrified of the small dragon, but the girl adopted it as her pet.

monsters.Name: Dracozul
monsters.Bio: Dracozuls are known primarily for two things: their beautiful azure-colored scales that shimmer brilliantly in the light, and their unruly ferocity. Despite being the only cold-blooded member of the Draco family, they are possibly the wildest out of all of them. When the Keeper of a Dracozul becomes too old, it is advised for them to give their Dracozul away - to prevent the Dracozul from breaking free through force.
monsters.History: Famously, the Dragon Empress kept a small regiment of trained dragon riders, who were called Dragonlords or Dragoons. When the Monster Keepers fought the kings of the Old World, a group of daring Keepers sought to revive this ancient practice. It took a lot of time, but eventually, they succeeded, dealing harrowing blows to the armies of the Old World. Dracozuls proved especially effective due to their unrivaled agility in the sky. Those Monster Keepers were given the honorary title of Keeper Dragoons.

monsters.Name: Druid Oak
monsters.Bio: Druid Oaks might be one of the toughest, most resilient and long-lived Monsters of the Sanctuary. It is near impossible to pierce a Druid Oak's body. And while they are sensitive to fire, they can never be burned entirely - they always regenerate from any damage they sustain.
monsters.History: Druid Oaks were created by an ancient magic that was practiced by the legendary druids of old. Some accounts call it a twisted, dark spell that created the Druid Oaks, but the Keepers don't abide by such superstition. As we know, aged druids often chose to let their soul return to nature, and the Druid Oaks represent a way to do so. Usually, a druid began the process during the last years of their life. They would take a chunk of a broken tree's dead wood and carve a face into it and add thick branches as limbs. Then, when the druid felt ready for it, they would transfer their soul into the piece of wood, creating a Druid Oak. The druid dies so that new life might flourish, and it is said that part of the druid's personality lives on in the Druid Oak they created.

monsters.Name: Elderjel
monsters.Bio: Elderjels are the only living biological entities in our world that are able to reverse their own aging process. Once they reach the final phase of their life cycle, the cells in their body undergo a miraculous process, which puts the Elderjel back into an earlier stage of its life. They can do this an indefinite number of times, even when they are injured or starving.
monsters.History: The ancient tome of demons, Ahrimaaya, clearly documents the history of the Elderjels. They came from another world and ruled the Earth from underwater palaces for eons, long before humankind developed. They fought a great war against Great Graamu and his spawn, during which the servants the Elderjels had created rebelled against them. Their empire crumbled, but not before they managed to land a decisive strike against Great Graamu: they banished his mind into an unending dream, cursing him to never wake and walk this world again.

monsters.Name: Frosty
monsters.Bio: Frosties burn with a freezing cold, extinguishing all heat around them - a supernatural phenomenon without a doubt. Neither wizards nor alchemists have ever managed to produce a flame that freezes the air around it, but many have tried.
monsters.History: According to popular folklore from the nordic countries, Frosties are the grandchildren of a mythical figure known as "Grandfather Frost". They reside in the uncharted Forests of Eversnow, where Grandfather Frost is also said to live, though no trace of him was ever found. These forests are among the few places in the Old World that are deemed safe for Monsters. Humans avoid those woods entirely, as it is near impossible to breach the sheer cold of the veil that surrounds those areas. Unfortunately, most Monsters would not survive living in the Forests of Eversnow either due to the aforementioned deadly chill and lack of food sources. Still, for safety's sake, several Frosties were brought to the Sanctuary in 177 AC. They seem to prefer staying close to the ponds and cool lakes of the Blue Caves. Many Keeper poets have since remarked on the beauty of a twirling Frosty's shine reflected upon the clear waters of the Blue Caves.

monsters.Name: Fungi
monsters.Bio: A biological miracle in the form of a sentient fungus that grew arms, muscles, and the capacity for volatile poison attacks. This allows the Fungi to protect itself against those who'd take mushrooms for easy pickings. Additionally, Fungis are able to generate a multitude of spores that spawn a variety of large, edible mushrooms. These oversized mushrooms can be harvested without danger and they provide plenty of nutritious nourishment. Many dishes that use these mushrooms carry "Fungi" in their name although they are only indirectly linked to this Monster.
monsters.History: It seems that there is little reason to hunt Fungis - especially since they provide their environment with food that doesn't need to be hunted. However, the nobles of the Old World and those who thought themselves noble had long developed a taste for the Fungi itself. Still, Fungis were never in danger of dying out thanks to their tenacity and longevity. Despite this fact, the first Monster Keepers deemed it despicable to go after the Fungis which only wanted to be left alone. By 2 AC, all of the Fungis of the forests and caverns of the Old World were gathered by the Keepers and taken to the Sanctuary.

monsters.Name: Glowdra
monsters.Bio: The Glowdra represents the mythical, dragon-type evolution of the humble Glowfly. They are expert fliers, with a tendency to migrate all over the world over their century-long lifespans. When they jet across the night sky, they are sometimes mistaken for shooting stars. In the Old World, only one in a thousand Glowflies would evolve into a Glowdra.
monsters.History: Fossil finds of the Glowdra date back to prehistoric times, similar to other dragon-type Monsters. It is theorized that the first Glowdras came into being during a time on this world when there was a chain reaction of cataclysmic volcanic eruptions. In large parts of the world, the air was heavily polluted with volcanic ash for decades. This led to the extinction of many species. However, some animals and insects evolved to harness the volcanic minerals in the air and thrive on them - they evolved into dragon-type Monsters. Therefore, it is speculated that Glowdras evolved from regular insects, but they then gradually evolved into the smaller Glowflies over thousands of years. So when a Glowfly evolves, it actually turns back into its jurassic form.

monsters.Name: Glowfly
monsters.Bio: Deceptively small, the Glowfly has often been seen as a regular insect, although its light outshines any common firefly by far. And while most bioluminescent creatures produce light without heat, the Glowfly's light emulates a miniature sun, cooling itself only through the constant beating of its wings.
monsters.History: Due to its peaceful nature and its tendency to dwell in isolated places, it was only in 187 AC that the Glowfly was recognized as a Monster. This discovery was made by Keeper Ranger Horrigan who went out to explore the uncharted regions within the large rainforests of the Old World. During the twilight hours, he saw a flickering, dimly-glowing light down on the forest soil, which turned out to be an injured Glowfly. Horrigan did what he could to nurse the small creature back to health, but decided to carry on his expedition regardless. Later on, he fell down a treacherous ravine, and a number of wild creatures preyed on him in this injured state. It was then that he was engulfed in a wreath of pulsing light - it was a horde of Glowflies. Any beast that came too close to the Keeper Ranger was torched by the Glowflies.

monsters.Name: Goblin Brute
monsters.Bio: Equipped with a flimsy-looking club and shield, this warrior of the Goblin tribe doesn't look like they'd put up much of a fight. However, the Goblin Brute shouldn't be underestimated. For one, their equipment is carved out of the sturdy, enchanted wood of the Ancient Woods' trees. And secondly, Goblin Brutes possess outstanding fighting skills, even when they have little to fight with - being able to transform any mundane object into a deadly weapon.
monsters.History: Goblinkind was created by the warlock Ryslind, centuries before the creation of the Monster Sanctuary. He resided in a dark tower in the middle of a vast forest full of Monsters and far away from all human civilization. Some romanticized versions of this tale state that Ryslind created the Goblins to keep him company in this desolate place, but it seems far more likely that he only desired to have expendable minions that would do his bidding. How it was possible for a human warlock to attain the power to will a new species into existence, we may never discover. Any records or tomes of Ryslind were destroyed.

monsters.Name: Goblin Hood
monsters.Bio: Their deadly aim is rivalled only by their survival instincts - for Goblins are a crafty folk who find ways to survive in any corner of this world. The Goblin Hood represents this quality more than any other type of Goblin. They are the hunters, trappers and survivalists of the tribe. Thanks to ingenuity and just a pinch of makeshift sorcery, they are able to hunt down almost any beast - with only a minimum of Goblin casualties.
monsters.History: It is believed that the warlock Ryslind created only a handful of Goblins. But they quickly multiplied, populating the forest around Ryslind's looming tower and constructing makeshift huts and villages. The Goblins had to find ways to fend for themselves, as Ryslind didn't provide his Goblin offsprings with anything but tasks. And so the first Goblin Hood arose, using bow and arrow to hunt game. However, he was soon eaten by a wild beast that roamed the forest. The second Goblin Hood learned from the first Hood's mistake. He snuck into the warlock's tower and spied on the warlock as he practiced his magic. And so the Goblins learned to harness the power of fire and ice.

monsters.Name: Goblin King
monsters.Bio: A great number of Goblin "tribes" populate the Ancient Woods, although each tribe functions more like a big family. There is too much squabbling and infighting among the Goblins to form a true tribe. Only when a Champion emerges from among the Goblins will the many tribe-families come together under one ruler - the Goblin King.
monsters.History: The Goblins were on the brink of extinction, as the human warlock Ryslind hunted them down for defying him. The tide of the war only turned when the Goblin Warlocks used their newfound powers to create a new type of Goblin: stronger, bigger, and more willful. This first Goblin King gathered all of the remaining Goblins around him, shouting them into submission. A legion of Goblins had been hiding in the caves and tunnels of the forest, and they all came out to fight as an army united by fear. They took the human warlock by surprise and defeated him.

monsters.Name: Goblin Miner
monsters.Bio: Goblin Miners are Goblins who have chosen to work in the gloomy and tepid mines of the Magma Chamber. It's quite surprising how organized Goblins can be when they work towards a common goal - in fact, the Goblin Miners even have a union. A Goblin Miner's pickaxe is his most prized possession, as the union assigns each Miner a single pickaxe that they are required to keep using until they go into retirement. However, retirement usually never happens due to the dangerous working conditions. It is the union's miserly business practices and their complete disregard of work ethics that have made them the Sanctuary's top supplier of coal and valuable minerals.
monsters.History: Some time after the Goblins had taken residence in the Ancient Woods of the Sanctuary, a group of Goblins ventured into the Magma Chamber. They encountered a Salahammer who was about to dispose of a failed creation in the magma pits. It was an ill-made attempt at a battle axe. However, the Salahammer instead sold it to the Goblins and told them that it was a pickaxe. That's how the Goblins' mining operation began.

monsters.Name: Goblin Pilot
monsters.Bio: Whoever claims that Goblins aren't meant for greatness has probably never encountered a Goblin Pilot. It's hard to say at this point whether this potential can ever be harnessed for the good of the Sanctuary, since there have been almost no records so far of Goblin Pilots being trained by Monster Keepers. Until then, Goblin Pilots will unfortunately only be known for their aptitude for wanton mayhem, large-scale demolitions and rude gestures.
monsters.History: For many years, Keepers observed the occasional Goblin or two wandering off into the Mystical Workshop. Sometimes they'd create ill-made tools and weapons, which usually were most harmful to the Goblin wielding it. When, in 473 AC, Keeper Knight Ikstrom first spotted a Goblin piloting a makeshift mechanical walker with flamethrower and chainsaw attached, he didn't know what to make of it. He underestimated the Goblin and, consequently, only barely escaped with his life.

monsters.Name: Goblin Warlock
monsters.Bio: Wielding a powerful staff and wearing the skull of a large rodent, the Goblin Warlock represents the tribe's witch doctor, shaman and scholar. They also teach the young, or at least they make an effort to do so. The most important subject of Goblin school is history, and every Goblin child gets taught about the creation of their kind through the human warlock Ryslind. Very few of them are able to recall the story - those are the ones who become Goblin Warlocks.
monsters.History: For many years and Goblin generations, the Goblins lived contentedly in the forest of the warlock Ryslind. However, there were some Goblins who looked up at the tall tower of Ryslind and wondered what powers could be found inside. Eventually, while the warlock was gone, a group of Goblins broke into the tower and they stole as many tomes and magic artifacts as they could carry. Immediately upon his return, Ryslind realized what had happened and he was furious. He demanded the Goblins turn the thieves over to him so they could be punished. The Goblins were eager to do so, but the group of thieves used the stolen artifacts to attack Ryslind, sparking a war between the Goblins and the human warlock.

monsters.Name: G'rulu
monsters.Bio: The dungeon-stalking G'rulu represents an altered form of the deep-sea Grummy. After this transformation, the G'rulu retains its mastery over the tides, but it prefers to inhabit dry places, with a preference towards man-made lairs. There are old stories of G'rulus creating such lairs within the underwater caves of the Old World. According to the ancient demon tome Ahrimaaya, the G'rulus are said to perform dark rituals in these lairs in an attempt to awaken their immortal master, the Great Graamu.
monsters.History: There are records of two groups of Monster Keepers that have embarked on expeditions to uncover those hidden lairs, in 113 AC and in 136 AC. Of the first expedition, nobody ever returned. The second expedition was led by Keeper Ranger Hollie Payton, the daughter of the first expedition's leader. She was determined to discover what tragedy had befallen her father and his daring expedition party. After their departure from the Sanctuary in 136 AC, none of them were seen again in years. It took five years until a single Keeper Novice from that doomed second expedition party returned to the Sanctuary. The boy returned as a mute and he never spoke another word until he died of natural causes in 236 AC.

monsters.Name: Grummy
monsters.Bio: These creatures from the dark corners of the ocean are known for their various supernatural qualities. They outlive humans by far, although scholars can't seem to agree on how long a Grummy can live for exactly. Old tales from the coastal areas say that a Grummy never forgets and never forgives, even as centuries pass and empires rise and fall. The skin of a Grummy is thick, spongy and toxic to a deadly degree, no matter how it is cooked or prepared. The insides of a Grummy are more similar to polyps than fishes or mammals.
monsters.History: Their biology indicates an otherworldly origin, which coincides with cryptic passages from the Ahrimaaya written by the Blind Starseer. This ancient book of demons was written in times when man was sparsely able to glimpse the terrors that lurk within our planet or beyond, and it holds knowledge that is still considered dangerous and abhorrent. According to these scriptures, Grummies entered our planet as the unholy entourage of the great Graamu, the deathless dreamer who holds the key to the ancient fallen realms of Sygoth and Nar'kenth. Great Graamu is said to reside in unseen realms underneath the sea, biding his time until he can take charge of this planet.

monsters.Name: Gryphonix
monsters.Bio: Gryphonixes are stout, fiery hybrid Monsters with the body of a lion and the wings and head of an eagle. Despite their rarity, they are one of the most well-known and celebrated Monsters, as is evidenced by their many depictions all across the Old World. They are known to be loyal defenders, having been employed by different human civilizations to protect great rulers, ancestral tombs, and caches of gold. Some even believed that the mere presence of a Gryphonix symbol could ward off evil.
monsters.History: The creation of the first Gryphonixes is attributed to a certain "sun god", which likely refers to the Spectral Eagle. This occurred around two thousand years before the creation of the Monster Sanctuary, when the Spectral Familiars were regarded as deities. The Gryphonixes were a gift to the Aztor kingdom, which always made sure to praise the sun.

monsters.Name: Ice Blob
monsters.Bio: An aura of winter surrounds these orb-like rotund creatures, and a cold breeze follows them wherever they go. Any Keeper with aspirations to climb the Snowy Peaks should be warned not to underestimate the Ice Blobs. Despite their dangerous nature, many Keepers believe that the Ice Blob doesn't seek to harm Keepers, and that they just can't help freezing all that surrounds them. Once an Ice Blob grows accustomed to a Keeper, they become slightly warmer to them - or perhaps the Keeper becomes more resistant to cold. In either case, a Keeper should always wear gloves while handling an Ice Blob, and no matter what: Don't lick it!
monsters.History: As noted before, the Blobs had been denizens of the Monster Sanctuary from the moment it was created. But at first, they were only seen strolling the green grasslands and hills of the Mountain Path. Over time, they spread and began to populate the other areas of the Sanctuary as well. One would think that a semi-solid creature like the Blob would simply freeze over in the Snowy Peaks, but somehow they adapted and took on the element of their surrounding.

monsters.Name: Imori
monsters.Bio: Imoris are courageous, armor-wielding lizard warriors with a strong sense of honor. An Imori makes a great bodyguard, who will fight to defend their charge even when they are outnumbered. The Imoris' technique aims to gradually injure and weaken the enemy with quick spear jabs. Their strikes are so fast and precise that it takes several seconds for their foes to realize that they've been wounded.
monsters.History: According to folklore, Imoris are the spirits of fallen warriors who were turned into lizards. Perhaps that was true for the first of their kind, but the Imoris developed their own culture, living in small villages deep inside tropical forests and mountain ranges. It is known that many lords and kings recruited Imoris as their personal bodyguards. Over time, humans preferred to rely on their own resources, while the services that the Imoris once provided for them became the stuff of distant legends. Still, the lords of the area that is the homeland to the Imoris always had great respect for them. When the Monster Sanctuary was created, the current lord sent a formal letter to the Monster Keepers, politely asking them to take care of the Imoris.

monsters.Name: Kame
monsters.Bio: Kames are large bipedal turtles famous for their mastery of martial arts. They are as comfortable on land as they are inside water, able to move surprisingly quick either way. Their power stems from their mastery over Chi: latent energy which flows inside all living beings. Kames have evolved with a natural ability to control Chi to increase the power of their strikes and to manifest their Chi outside their body in the form of sudden heat blasts.
monsters.History: Centuries ago, aspiring martial artists would travel to Kame island which used to be the home of all Kames. The martial artists would study the Kames and attempt to replicate their mastery over Chi. There are stories of several human warriors who were able to master the Chi after living on Kame island for several years or even decades. Each of them became a legendary warrior in their own right, winning fighting tournaments and using their power for the good of mankind. For it is said that, if a human were to use the Chi to do evil, the Kames would find them and put them in their place.

monsters.Name: Kanko
monsters.Bio: Kankos were summoned and bound to our world by shamans. The only way to bring forth a Kanko is through the embers and smoke of a pipe, which is why they are also referred to as "pipe foxes". They exude an aura of protection against evil spirits and are fiercely defensive when guarding the one they consider their master. They are formidable against even the largest of evil spirits.
monsters.History: In the year 90 AC, a hundred-year-old man came to the Monster Sanctuary. He was one of the last remnants of a solitary mountain village. He had to leave his home to preserve their ancient mystic arts, for he was the last in a long line of spirit summoners. After spending some time in the Sanctuary, he deemed it a safe haven for the spirits that he had brought with him. That's how the art of summoning Kankos has become known to the Sanctuary.

monsters.Name: King Blob
monsters.Bio: King Blobs are the proud monarchs of the Blob family. They are much larger than any of the other Blobs, bear a slime-drenched crown and scepter, and they are known to be able to command other Blobs to do their bidding.
monsters.History: Since 155 AC, a number of King Blobs have appeared in seemingly random places of the Monster Sanctuary, always posing a danger that should not be underestimated. If left alone for too long, a King Blob will amass legions upon legions of loyal Blobs. The very first King Blob managed to rile up an army of Blobs large enough to conquer the entire Mountain Path. It appears that King Blobs are created when several smaller Blobs come together and combine. King Blobs are said to represent the shared anger of the many Blobs of the Sanctuary, which are often not taken seriously due to their nice and well-meaning nature.

monsters.Name: Koi
monsters.Bio: Not to be confused by the ordinary (albeit equally beautiful) fish that goes by the same name, the Monster Kois aren't shackled by their namesakes' earthly boundaries. They may swim in any direction they choose, and they do so in a way that seems completely effortless. No matter if they're swimming upstream, diving into the darkest depths or gliding through thin air, it seems all the same to them. Therefore, they are seen as living symbols of pure freedom and the ability to choose your own destiny.
monsters.History: In the Old World, a large, monstrous Koi would sometimes be seen hovering and gliding above a river. It was always followed by a school of its ordinary namesake that would try to jump out of the water to get closer to the mythical Koi leader. According to legend, it would guide them to their destiny - or, in more practical terms, it guided them towards safer waters. Some of the Monster Kois decided to come to the Monster Sanctuary, but it is believed that most of them still fulfil their mission as guides in the Old World. Only a fool would attempt to hunt a Monster Koi or imprison it.

monsters.Name: Kongamato
monsters.Bio: The name of this Monster means "breaker of boats", which it was given due to its sheer strength. What most don't know, however, is that it is actually capable of crushing an entire boat to splinters through its super sonic scream. Another remarkable quality of them is the fact that - unlike bird chicks which require to be reared and taught carefully - Kongamatos hatch with fully developed wings and are able to take flight in a matter of seconds after hatching. Therefore, they are seen as more solitary and individualistic creatures than birds.
monsters.History: As we can tell from numerous fossil finds across the world, this flying reptile has populated our world for millions of years, similar to the Crystal Snail. It is even believed that the Kongamato was one of the first creatures on this world that was capable of powered flight. They are believed to be the ancestors of birds, birdlike Monsters and dragonlike Monsters as well. Somehow, a group of these prehistoric creatures survived to this day on a remote chain of small, mountainous islands. The native people of those islands revere them as godlike beings.

monsters.Name: Lava Blob
monsters.Bio: Lava Blobs are the fiery, explosive and much less stable descendants of the common Blobs of the Mountain Path. In fact, it appears as if their bodies are in a constant state of fluidity, always about to lose their shape and fall apart. However, Lava Blobs always manage to keep it together, which many believe to be quite an admiring feat. Only when they get particularly excited, they might leave a drop of themselves behind, which slowly burns into the ground. Once it has cooled down, it provides the earth with valuable minerals and gives it healing properties.
monsters.History: Groups of Blobs have always been attracted by the glowing magma pits of the Magma Chamber. It is advised for Keepers traversing the Magma Chamber to always keep an eye out for their Blobs, as they might attempt to take a bath in the magma pits. It's not deadly for Blobs to come in contact with the magma, but it's certainly not healthy, either. It took years for the Blobs of Magma Chamber to change and adapt to their surroundings, taking on the qualities of molten magma themselves.

monsters.Name: Mad Eye
monsters.Bio: A group of these creatures is referred to as an "audience of Mad Eyes". They seem to share a telepathic link with each other while in close proximity. A whole audience of Mad Eyes will always focus on anything strange and unknown to them, as if they could discern its nature by staring at it long enough. Curiously, each Mad Eye possesses a second brain in their tail which sometimes works against the Mad Eye's interests.
monsters.History: It was quite shocking when the existence of Mad Eyes was discovered in 202 AC. They were found living in expansive cave systems deep underneath the Old World, which they may have created themselves over thousands of years or more. The vast majority of Mad Eyes still dwell there, as it would be impossible to relocate the entire Mad Eye population to the Sanctuary. The underground world of the Mad Eyes was closed off shortly after its discovery, as it is widely believed that some things should be left the way they are. Still, the mad Keeper Master Azhar broke into that forlorn place within a year of its discovery and brought just a handful of Mad Eyes to the Sanctuary, which have since grown into a sizable audience.

monsters.Name: Mad Lord
monsters.Bio: The Mad Lord is the mysterious, powerful ruler of the Mad Eyes. If one were to believe the writings of the mad Keeper Master Azhar, the Mad Lord's middle eye sees all that transpires in our world, the left eye peers into the past, the right eye watches over the stars, and the sword eye gazes into the minds of all mortals.
monsters.History: We now know that the cause for Azhar's madness was the Mad Lord. It was him who beckoned Azhar to travel to the Old World and open up the barred underground world of the Mad Eyes. Somehow, the Mad Lord was able to enter and hide inside Azhar's body, and so, when Azhar returned to the Sanctuary, he brought the Mad Lord with him. Azhar eventually managed to expel the Mad Lord from his body, forcing him to show his true form. The Mad Lord, however, escaped shortly after, never to be seen again.

monsters.Name: Magmamoth
monsters.Bio: As though the Magmapillar hadn't already evolved far beyond all predators of the animal kingdom, the Magmamoth represents its final adult form - the imago. In addition to its innate ability to generate heat, it gains mastery over the winds thanks to its double set of powerful wings. However, it barely uses its physical power to fly - instead, it generates hot air that pushes its wings and body upwards. Using this method of propulsion, it can ascend to the heavens and vanish out of eyesight within a minute.
monsters.History: The thick, dark forests where the Magmamoth prefers to dwell were shunned by the people of the Old World. However, as humanity made advances in technology, they engineered machines and protective suits that allowed them to fight back against the heat of the Magmamoths. The dying Magmamoths burst into flames, setting fire to the forests and causing a mad spiral of destruction. It was this event that sparked the war between the first Monster Keepers and the kings of the Old World. The Spectral Familiars gave a special kind of magic to those Monster Keepers that allowed them to harness and hatch the eggs of the Magmamoth and of other Monsters as well.

monsters.Name: Magmapillar
monsters.Bio: This gigantic caterpillar has evolved beyond all predators of the animal kingdom, but even more impressive is its ability to generate intense heat and even flame by way of metabolic heat. Unlike other insects, the Magmapillar doesn't have to bask in the sun to maintain its body temperature, although Magmapillars can sometimes be seen lying together in groups to increase their collective heat. Once a Magmapillar reaches a certain age, it creates a cocoon of searing hot silk around itself. Any living thing that comes close to this cocoon gets burned to a crisp.
monsters.History: It has been documented since the first days of the Monster Sanctuary how to quench the severe blazing heat of the Magmapillar's silk. Once the silk is stripped away of its scorching heat, it can be woven into sturdy, long-lasting garments with magical properties. Most Keeper clothes are made in this way. The Magmapillars belonged to the original monster species that were endangered by the infamous "greed of kings" which the monuments along the Keeper's Trail speak of. Magmapillars and their adult forms were instrumental in the war between the first Monster Keepers and the kings of the Old World, and they have been the trusty companions of Keepers ever since.

monsters.Name: Manticorb
monsters.Bio: Lacking appreciable teeth or claws with which to fight, the Manticorb defends itself entirely by magical means. Its thick, fluffy coat serves to absorb large amounts of errant Mana from the surrounding atmosphere, which it can cast at will from the tip of its tail, much like a wand. It carries so much magical energy inside its small body that its large eye even emits light in dark places. A skilled Manticorb can become quite adept in wielding multiple attack elements, and predators are quick to learn that the warning stripes are no joke.
monsters.History: Manticorbs have a natural tendency to gather where Mana is strongly concentrated, and as a result ended up flocking to the Monster Sanctuary of their own volition. Their curious demeanor and soft fur makes them attractive pets at a glance, but they can quickly become unruly and volatile if they are allowed to build up too much Mana at a time. Experienced Keepers can monitor a Manticorb's level of charge by the amount of static in its fur, and will have it regularly cast spells to discharge the excess.

monsters.Name: Mega Rock
monsters.Bio: What do you get when naive, but powerful nature spirits are forced to defend their habitats from complete destruction? Mega Rocks are the imposing answer to that question. Simply put, a Mega Rock is created when a Rocky's inherent talent for nature manipulation is pushed beyond its limits.
monsters.History: Mega Rocks have been emerging since ancient times, but it was always under specific, rare circumstances. When natural catastrophes such as hurricanes or wildfires threatened to destroy nature itself, Rockies would transform into Mega Rocks to put a halt to those catastrophes. However, around 53 AC, Mega Rocks started emerging in great numbers in the Old World, violently protecting their environments from humankind. Some Mega Rocks grew to gigantic sizes, incomparable to any other Monster in history. Eventually, they became enraged and pushed back against humanity, storms of thunder and fire following them in their wake. They could have put an end to the entire Old World - if it weren't for the merciful intervention of Monster Keepers, who knew how to tame the Mega Rocks. The Old World offered payment to the Keepers, but they refused - the services of Monster Keepers shall never be for sale.

monsters.Name: Megataur
monsters.Bio: This boreal breed of gargantuan beast-men has perfectly adapted to the dire and challenging conditions of the frosty mountaintops of Snowy Peaks. This resulted in strength, endurance and sturdiness that are unparalleled within the entire Monster Sanctuary. While the Megataur is surprisingly mild-tempered, those who enter their territory are advised not to enrage them - once their anger is ignited, there is only one way to save yourself: flee at once. Within their territory, the Megataurs reign supremely.
monsters.History: As we know from history, the Minitaur represents the smaller version of the original Minotaur, guardian of the mythical labyrinth. After the ancient Minotaur split itself apart, the Minitaurs remained as they were for hundreds of years. Only once their kind was brought to the Sanctuary and a tribe of Minitaurs moved to the Snowy Peaks, were they able to regain part of their former glory: They evolved into the larger and more muscular Megataurs. But at the same time, they moved away from their old ways, as the Megataur solely relies on its brute strength and its control of the elements. Therefore, they are a whole new breed of Monster that only came to life thanks to the Monster Sanctuary.

monsters.Name: Mimic
monsters.Bio: Mimics are spirits that are cursed to remain inside of treasure chests. With nothing better to do, they tend to sit still and wait patiently for adventurers to approach, longing for the opportunity to let out their anger on them.
monsters.History: Mimics were originally gluttonous spirits that haunted a certain wealthy kingdom of the Old World. It was a godless kingdom that was known as a paradise for commerce, imposing no rules whatsoever on what kinds of goods could be bought and sold. One day, Mimics started appearing in the kingdom, seeking out treasuries and any other places with coffers filled to the brim with coin, gemstones or other precious treasures. They would go from one treasure chest to another, eating up everything that they could find inside. Eventually, a wandering priest came to that realm and decided to take on the gluttonous spirits. He used richly-decorated treasure chests that were now empty and turned them into spirit traps. When a Mimic next entered the chest, it got trapped inside, cursed to remain inside for all eternity. The Mimics were successfully conquered, but it was already too late for the now impoverished kingdom.

monsters.Name: Minitaur
monsters.Bio: These five feet tall bovine warriors expertly wield their oversized war axes like no human could. Beyond their martial prowess, they also wield spells of different kinds to enhance their destructive potential and protect their kin. An enraged Minitaur at their full potential might summon a Stone Rain as destructive as the impact of a meteor.
monsters.History: The story of the Minotaur is deeply embedded in ancient mythology. The story of the Minitaur, on the other hand, is a lesser known one. It begins with a band of clever adventurers who sought to get to the treasure hidden within the Minotaur's labyrinth. Those five adventurers went into the Labyrinth together, but each of them took a different path. The Minotaur couldn't be in all places at once and so he split himself in five, creating the first Minitaurs and fending off the intruders.

monsters.Name: Moccus
monsters.Bio: Moccuses are boars that were once mummified and entombed, but came to life again and escaped their constraints with undying vigor. Moccuses carry a great number of toxins and parasitic spores inside their bodies that they unleash wherever they go. They also possess magic that lies at the border between life and death.
monsters.History: In ancient times, there was a people that zealously worshipped a deity that had the form of a boar. This deity was associated with fertility, responsible for bountiful harvests and successful child births of humans and animals alike. However, a great dry spell befell that people for many years, harvests growing shorter and shorter with each passing year. The priests preached to their people that their sinful ways had made them fall out of favor with their deity. According to them, drastic measures were needed to appease their deity. So they sacrificed grown boars by mummifying them and entombing them near the fields. However, this had the opposite effect - it enraged their deity, who gave new life to those sacrificial boars and turned them into harbingers of pestilence, unleashing the opposite of what the priests had hoped for.

monsters.Name: Mogwai
monsters.Bio: Small, furry creatures that seem docile and well-meaning at first glance. Turning one's back to a Mogwai reveals their impish or even diabolical nature. Getting hit by a snowball in the back while the Mogwai retreats with a goatlike laughter is one of the milder types of Mogwai misdeeds. Give too much trust to a Mogwai and you might end up chasing after that same Mogwai as it's running off with your backpack and supplies. The Mogwais used to hoard their stolen goods in secret caves that they dug under their remote mountain villages.
monsters.History: In ancient times, there were nobles and rulers who would attempt to keep a Mogwai as a pet. A set of rules for Mogwai keeping were written down in this time period. It is said that these rules shall never be broken, or else one might risk great calamities. However, no records remain of any of these rules, despite many Keepers scouring the Old World for them. Therefore, it is not known what the Keeper of a Mogwai should do or refrain from doing. If you still want to keep a Mogwai, you should probably be very careful in general.

monsters.Name: Molebear
monsters.Bio: Quite possibly one of the highest evolved beasts of the animal kingdom, however the sharp claws and spikes of the Molebear mainly serve as defensive tools, as the Molebear's diet consists of plants it forages and insects it finds in the ground. Molebears feel most at home in the underground caverns that they create themselves over years of effort. During the winter, the Molebears stay hidden in the deepest reaches of these caves, where they are safe from the freezing colds above.
monsters.History: The Molebears were regarded as dangerous creatures in the Old World, but the Monster Keepers always knew the Molebears as peaceful and mild-tempered beings. Still, it was quite a huge undertaking to bring the Molebears to the Sanctuary, and it was finished only by 44 AC. In the centuries since, the Molebears have formed an expansive system of interlinked caves and tunnels underneath the Ancient Woods. Recently, these tunnels have even become connected to the abandoned Stronghold Dungeon. Even though the Ancient Woods never see snowfall, the Monsters of the Ancient Woods use the Molebears' caves as shelter when it's stormy outside. The Molebears and Magmamoths of the Ancient Woods have come to a truce of sorts, as they are evenly matched in power.

monsters.Name: Monk
monsters.Bio: These mysterious humanoids never speak and live in solitude. It's said that they dwell in secret places, in caves hidden behind waterfalls where they might even establish makeshift monasteries. However, there are many stories of Monks coming to the aid of injured mountain climbers, nourishing them back to health and guiding them along the treacherous mountain paths.
monsters.History: The Monks are one of the few Monster species that immigrated willingly to the Monster Sanctuary. In 3 AC, it is assumed that all of the Monks who lived in the mountain lands of the Old World left their hidden domiciles and ventured to the Monster Sanctuary. Perhaps they saw that it was inevitable for the humans of the Old World to encroach on their sacred monasteries and shrines. Indeed, many of the abandoned monasteries left behind in the Old World have since been pillaged and destroyed.

monsters.Name: Nautilid
monsters.Bio: Nautilids bear their name due to their superficial similarity to the marine mollusc nautilus. However, they are closer related to squids. They are blue-blooded, have multiple hearts and they may shoot clouds of ink to blind their foes, although they also developed a set of other defense mechanisms that aid them against all types of predators. Its unnerving "face" is more like a mask: a thick, bony plate which protects the Nautilid's actual face. When it wants to eat, it has to slightly lift up its mask.
monsters.History: According to ancient scriptures, the Nautilids were bio-engineered by the Elderjels - same as the crab-like Ucans were. They came into being after Great Graamu entered our world with his spawn army - Grummies and G'rulus. Same as the Elderjels, the G'rulus created vast underwater cities and palaces, and they too strove for the dominion of our world. Great Graamu was able to bend the minds of many ocean Monsters to his will to use as foot soldiers, and so the Elderjels created a breed of foot soldiers for their own armies: the Nautilids. However, this is ancient history - the Elderjels aren't what they once were and the Nautilids haven't been their thralls for millions of years.

monsters.Name: Nightwing
monsters.Bio: The Nightwing is possibly the most stealthy predator that nature has ever produced. It produces no audible sound and it seems as if it's able to meld with the shadows - a combination of extremely keen instincts and magic. It is known to feed on the blood of humans, animals and even other Monsters. It is believed to be able to see in the dark, sense the blood of any warm-blooded being from miles away, and hear the breathing sound of a sleeping human or animal.
monsters.History: There are many stories and myths in the Old World surrounding the Nightwing. The names of the Nightwing are countless: King of the Night, Blood-Demon, Vampire and Chupacabra are only a few of them. However, it was only a matter of time until humanity's desire for expansion encroached on their territory. More and more forests vanished so that factories and cities could be built, until the Nightwing was pushed away into the caves, sewers and ruins of the Old World. In 129 AC, a group of Monster Keepers decided to bring the Nightwings to the Sanctuary, despite the perceived difficulty of such a mission. They were surprised to find that the Nightwings were quite eager to come with them.

monsters.Name: Ninki
monsters.Bio: The Ninki represents the first form of the Ninki Nanka, the fearsome river dragon. Ninkis are almost never seen in the wilds, as their mothers are fiercely protective of them. It is said to bring bad luck to see a Ninki in the wild, as the mother will likely be angered that a human managed to come so close to her young. The scales and fur of Ninkis are always covered in a layer of mud, which is the source of their longevity and their healing powers. Therefore, a Ninki shouldn't be exposed to great heat or strong currents - or else their mud layer might dry off.
monsters.History: Until the fourth century, the Ninkis and Ninki Nankas lived in peace, undisturbed by the technological advances of humanity. It was a slow and gradual decline that destroyed the livable territory of their species. When a group of Keepers came to their territory in 311 AC, most of the Ninki Nankas were sickly and weak because their mighty river had grown shallow and devoid of the minerals that they needed to thrive. Still, they were extremely defensive and didn't let the Keepers close to them.

monsters.Name: Ninki Nanka
monsters.Bio: A mighty river dragon that is said to live for hundreds of years. The key difference between a Ninki and a Ninki Nanka is that the mud layer that coats the Ninki Nanka's scales and fur contains volcanic minerals, which grants them even more resilience and power. A Ninki enters adulthood by bathing in a primordial pool of volcanic mud that lies hidden deep underneath the earth.
monsters.History: The group of Keepers stayed in the territory of the Ninki Nankas for several months, not knowing how to convince the proud and headstrong river dragons to come with them. One day, one of the sickly Ninki Nankas inexplicably died a sudden death. It seemed as if it had simply lost its will to live. It left behind a couple of famished Ninki calves, which none of the other Ninki Nankas were able to take care of. Naturally, the Keepers took in the abandoned Ninkis and nurtured them as best as they could. That is how the Keepers won the trust of the Ninki Nankas. Only a handful of their species stayed behind, and it is believed that they are still hiding in the most remote corners of their once majestic territory.

monsters.Name: Oculus
monsters.Bio: Oculi are a technological marvel without equal in the Sanctuary as well as in the Old World. An Oculus's eye is made of several state-of-the-art lenses of transparent adamantium that can be moved at will, granting the Oculus visual acuity that is possibly beyond any other being in existence.
monsters.History: Oculi were created by Steam Golems in the Mystical Workshop at an unknown point in time. It is likely that their design was inspired by insects, both in terms of anatomy as well as behavior. The Oculi were presumably intended to use their precise vision and heat capabilities to be intelligent welding instruments for the Golems. The Oculi instead used their heat lasers to burrow into the walls of the Workshop, creating complex cave systems. The number of Oculi that occupy the walls of the Workshop is unknown. It seems that they have broken out into different colonies, working largely independently of the Steam Golems. Amusingly, there is a small group of individuals who believe that the Oculi have since created another type of intelligent mechanical Monsters that are too small for the human eye to see.

monsters.Name: Ornithopter
monsters.Bio: Ornithopters are mechanical beings capable of perpetual flight. They are kept in motion through mysterious mechanisms that are hidden within the barrel-shaped body. Being one of the most puzzling inventions in history, they have inspired many attempts to copy their design or improve on it, which have all failed so far.
monsters.History: Ornithopters were created by Leonardo the Great, one of the most brilliant minds in history. They were created centuries before the Sanctuary and are the first mechanical Monsters created by humans in history. The Ornithopters' design was based on acute, long-lived observations of animals and Monsters capable of flight. The final element needed to keep the Ornithopter in motion, however, eluded Leonardo for many years. The Ornithopters' design was only completed when Leonardo began to dabble in sorcery in his later years, which only became known years after his death. Trying to keep the magical mechanisms of the Ornithopters secret from the puritan authorities, Leonardo placed a magical seal on them; if the seal is broken in any way, the mechanisms within the Ornithopter completely fall apart.

monsters.Name: Plague Egg
monsters.Bio: These oval creatures bear an appearance similar to the garb of an ancient order which practices alchemy. Plague Eggs are usually reclusive and only rarely appear to attempt to cure illnesses and injuries on unattended patients. However, interrupting their "operations" or attempting to capture them will provoke them to attack with magic, which curses and interrupts the biological functions of living creatures. Their cures sometimes resemble ominous experiments - for instance, they might save a human's life, but at the price of their legs. Conversely, sometimes they add enhancements to their patient's bodies, such as additional limbs or wings, but neglect to treat their illnesses. Thankfully, when raised by Keepers, they do not practice such behavior.
monsters.History: Plague Eggs were first seen in the Sanctuary in 204 AC. Due to their appearance, it's assumed someone within the Sanctuary must have created them through magical experiments on Monster eggs. It's unknown who would've done so and why. Despite their unknown origin and their occasionally erratic behavior, they are seen as another welcome addition to the Monster Sanctuary. Some residents of the Sanctuary have even sought out their treatment when conventional medicines have failed them.

monsters.Name: Polterofen
monsters.Bio: Polterofens are old-fashioned ovens that came alive through supernatural means. According to popular belief, some household objects may be rewarded with a soul after serving for a hundred years. Most Polterofens, however, only come alive once their owners decide to replace them with a newer model. As a result, the Polterofen becomes enraged and turns against its owner. Other Polterofens, on the other hand, only turn alive after their owners have moved to another house. Left behind, those Polterofens become filled with grief and sometimes set out to find their original owners.
monsters.History: For a long time, Polterofens weren't regarded as Monsters, but as supernatural phenomenons that had to be combated through exorcisms, since Polterofens were usually only found in households which they refused to leave. After an old spirit summoner came to the Sanctuary in 90 AC and shared his craft with the Sanctuary, some Keepers set out into the Old World in search of different Spirit-type Monsters. They used what they had learned to communicate with the Polterofens and calm them down. They convinced them that the Monster Sanctuary could be a home for them that they'd never have to leave.

monsters.Name: Promethean
monsters.Bio: Prometheans are undead that were brought to life through a combination of Alchemy and the Old World's "science". Electricity is the most vital component to their existence, so a number of devices are attached to their bodies to keep the electricity in their body in check.
monsters.History: There was a mad scientist in the Old World called Victor who spent many years trying to reanimate a corpse. In 386 AC, he finally succeeded. This first walking dead was never given a name by his creator, and he was a crude, grisly creation, but he had a conscious of his own. Victor was overly ecstatic over his success, and so he promptly created several more reanimated undead. Victor's first creation always observed those processes and he spent many hours in Victor's great libraries. He, as well as his siblings, still lacked free will, being forced to obey their creator. However, Victor didn't notice that his first creation was adding augmentations to his own body. Those augmentations allowed him to resist his master's call and fight back against him. He came to be called Prometheus, and the undead he added those same augmentations to were called Prometheans.

monsters.Name: Qilin
monsters.Bio: A rare, solitary creature that avoids contact to humans and other Monsters at almost all times. It seems that a Qilin is most at ease while it's enjoying a moment of pure solitude in nature. Therefore, Qilins are considered to be gentle and pure-hearted, without any intention to bother or disturb other living beings.
monsters.History: It's believed that a Qilin will only show itself to an exceptional Keeper who has caught the Qilin's attention. It never happens more than once every twenty years or so, but it's always seen as a sign of good fortune for the entire Monster Sanctuary. Even though it might just be superstition, the Keeper of a Qilin is usually treated with a lot of respect and their opinions are greatly valued. It's almost as if people believe that the Qilin grants its Keeper great wisdom. Who knows - perhaps that is actually the case?

monsters.Name: Raduga
monsters.Bio: The most majestic of all bird-like Monsters, save perhaps for the Spectral Eagle. But whereas the Spectral Eagle governs the powers of storm and sun, the Raduga symbolizes universal balance. Its distinct long tail feathers symbolize the four main elements of nature, and its mere presence fills all beings around it with hope and vigor.
monsters.History: For hundreds of years, Monster Keepers travelled the Old World in search of this mythical being. The myths hint towards the Raduga only appearing in lands that are at complete peace and tranquility. But the Raduga remained elusive as ever even when there weren't any wars fought in the Old World. In 400 AC, on the anniversary day of the Sanctuary's creation, the Keepers were amazed to see a Raduga flying high in the sky above the Sanctuary. Needless to say, the Keepers rejoiced and celebrated like they had never celebrated before.

monsters.Name: Rainbow Blob
monsters.Bio: Rainbow Blobs are the rarest and the most colorful offspring of the Blobs of Monster Sanctuary. They possess the combined qualities and abilities of the three more common Blobs, and they inexplicably also have power over lightning. Being able to heat up the air around them, as well as to summon a cool breeze, they'd make a great addition for any home. To this date, however, only a handful of Monster Keepers in history are known to have possessed Rainbow Blobs. None of them gave away any hints as to where they got their Rainbow Blobs from.
monsters.History: The Rainbow Blobs' rarity led to the belief that they get created when a regular Blob finds the end of a rainbow and then gets struck by lightning. More likely, only the latter part of that myth is true. An extreme amount of voltage surging through the Blob's body could have led to the transformation into the Rainbow Blob. This would prove the Blob's innate adaptability even more so than the existence of the Ice and Lava Blobs.

monsters.Name: Rocky
