monsters.Bio: Despite their name, there is mystery surrounding what these well-meaning nature spirits are made of. Their exterior is hard and unyielding like rock, and anyone who tries to lift a Rocky will break their back trying to raise its extremely heavy body. But then how would it be possible for plants and flowers to sprout out of their bodies? The only explanation is that Rockies are capable of controlling nature to a degree that is unequaled by any other monster - their very existence combines the qualities of rock, earth and plant life.
monsters.History: Stories of Rockies have been shared across many countries of the world since the dawn of mankind. As long as anyone can remember, Rockies had been the shy denizens of dense forests, bright groves and cragged mountains alike. Still, Rockies rarely showed themselves to anyone, and even a wanderer or woodsman might never encounter a single Rocky in their life. Instead, it would usually be the young or the naive that spot a Rocky. One popular story even tells of a young boy who had lost his way in the forest and happened upon a group of Rockies that played with him and then guided him back to his homestead.

monsters.Name: Salahammer
monsters.Bio: Throughout history, Salahammers have been known as master smiths, using their internal fires to fuel their forge. It is believed that some Salahammers are obsessed with the creation of the perfect weapon, which may even cut through diamond with ease, while other Salahammers instead seek out to create an indestructible suit of armor, which would protect its wearer from all harm.
monsters.History: Salahammers have most often kept to themselves, working in volcanic caverns and other places that are hard to reach. Periodically, a lord would be able to entice one of them into his services, which gave the lord’s armies an edge over their opponents due to the quality of the gear the Salahammer would produce. Even more rare than an army equipped by a Salahammer were those with one in their ranks, who proved to be devastating in combat when they had a reason to fight. After the creation of the Monster Sanctuary, most Salahammers migrated there, attracted by the solitude it promised. Many of them developed a productive relationship with the Steam Golems and the other constructs of the workshop, while some Salahammers prefer the heat of the Magma Chamber.

monsters.Name: Shockhopper
monsters.Bio: Shockhoppers used to make their homes on remote icy islands. Never having had contact with humans, they were very friendly to visitors. Their feathers were short and coursed with static electricity at all times, giving anyone quite the shock when they tried to pet the fuzzy little penguins. They could use their electricity to propel themselves into the air to leap from rock to rock, aiding in evading predators.
monsters.History: In 62 AC, Shockhoppers were first discovered by Old World explorers. At this point in time, the Old World was beginning to grasp the possibility of using electricity as a source of energy. Since Shockhoppers quickly became known for their ability to generate electricity, many experiments were conducted with Shockhoppers. Nearly every experiment ended with the Shockhoppers being completely converted into electricity, ending up as only a short-lived source of energy. Those experiments were soon outlawed, but poachers continued supplying illicit laboratories with Shockhopper eggs. Eventually, the population of Shockhoppers was damaged beyond the point of recovery and they vanished from the world. The tragedy that befell the Shockhoppers is counted among one of the Old World's biggest crimes.

monsters.Name: Silvaero
monsters.Bio: Silvaeros are an evolutionary offshoot of Vaeros, which have become much larger due to the natural phenomenon of island gigantism. Some even believe that the Silvaeros used to be much larger before they came to the Monster Sanctuary - but it's hard to say, due to the many conflicting accounts and exaggerated stories. The feathers of the Silvaero are practically charged with magical energy, capable of invoking the full force of the winds of winter. In particular, the silver feathers of the Silvaero are sometimes kept by Monster Keepers as lucky charms.
monsters.History: When sailors first found the distant Silvaero islands, they were in awe of this mighty monstrous bird's size. Their accounts led to the Silvaeros' inclusion in many popular folktales and stories, their size becoming an ever increasing exaggeration. It is probably true that those sailors saw a Silvaero swooping down from the sky to pick up and carry off a fully-grown elephant. However - what most accounts neglect to mention - when the sailors got closer to the elephants, they realized that they were pygmy elephants, which had grown smaller due to island dwarfism.

monsters.Name: Sizzle Knight
monsters.Bio: What happens when you expose a gloomy Crackle Knight to the incandescence that fills the halls of the Sun Palace? Most don't even care enough to look up. However, some Crackle Knights take a strange liking to the miniature sun that illuminates the Sun Palace - so much so that they change their entire nature. As Sizzle Knights of Sun Palace, they become much more jovial and expressive. They cannot talk, but sometimes you can hear a low chuckle coming from their helmets when they are in a joyful mood.
monsters.History: It doesn't happen often, but there is at least one story of an untamed Crackle Knight that came to the Sun Palace and was changed to a Sizzle Knight. They didn't stay in the Sun Palace for too long - instead, they travelled throughout the entire Sanctuary, trying to find opportunities to help people in need. The stories of their heroic deeds are beyond count. It's also said that it was them who hid Sun Stones in the Sun Palace which help others of its kind become warriors of sunlight.

monsters.Name: Skorch
monsters.Bio: Known as "candle dragons", Skorches are the smallest and most unassuming dragon-type Monsters. They also have overly cheery and friendly dispositions, and it is said that a Skorch would never fight for itself. For those reasons, Skorches were long considered to be only fit as pets. However, if a Skorch is treated for years with love and respect by a human, something grows inside of them. When the time comes, and the Skorch's Keeper is threatened, it is as if the Skorch's very soul suddenly lights up. The Skorch becomes incredibly fierce and fiery, its fighting strength only limited by the bond to its Keeper.
monsters.History: The first Skorches were created from ordinary candles by a warlock. He had wished to have the power of dragons at his command. However, he only took a single glance at his creations and threw them out. It is believed that Skorches carry the burden of this disappointment to this day, and it is for this reason that they so desire to bond with a Keeper. Skorches came to the Sanctuary out of their own accord when it was created.

monsters.Name: Specter
monsters.Bio: A blazing phantom that bears the shape of a human's skeleton. It is believed that its flames are capable of burning away both flesh and spirit - that if you get too close to a hostile Specter's fire, you might lose a part of your soul. According to the accounts of unfortunate Keeper Rangers, it would burn away into a puff of smoke that smells like brimstone. Furthermore, these unfortunate Keepers experienced an unnatural chill in their bones, which would only dissipate after a few days.
monsters.History: The first Specter appeared in the Monster Sanctuary in 13 AC. It seemed to be peaceable, sticking to its territory. However, stories of Keepers who approached it and experienced strange sensations quickly spread throughout the Sanctuary and spurred superstition. Some Monster Keepers argued that the Specter was an incarnation of evil and had to be vanquished. However, the Spectral Keepers decided that all Monsters deserved sanctuary.

monsters.Name: Spectral Eagle
monsters.Bio: The people of the Old World regarded the Spectral Eagle as the bravest of the Spectral Familiars. He was said to be an embodiment of the sun, having control of the winds and the weather. Some particularly colorful stories also speak of hidden realms above the clouds that were ruled by the Spectral Eagle alone. Nonetheless, he had great importance to sailors, the traders of the port cities and the people of the great deserts. To this day, pirate captains keep birds of colorful splendor as their pets as a way to honor the Spectral Eagle.
monsters.History: Since 0 AC, the Spectral Eagle has been the Spectral Familiar of the Thiazi family. They are a seafaring people by tradition, and they are in charge of all trade that is undertaken between the Monster Sanctuary and the Old World - which is only done by ship. It is written that the Eagle and the original keeper of the Eagle sacrificed themselves in the war between the first Monster Keepers and the kings of the Old World. The Eagle rose again from his ashes after a few days, and he cried for his fallen Keeper for an entire day.

monsters.Name: Spectral Lion
monsters.Bio: Tales from the Old World make the Spectral Lion out to be the noblest and most heroic of the Familiars, ruling over the great prairies and tropical jungles. Some ancient texts of a civilization long forgotten even attribute the creation of the deserts to him. There are a great many tales of him fighting against evil and hunting down demons, but the stories also often warn that you should never draw the Lion's wrath upon yourself. The Lion was believed to guard those who were devoted to him and those of pure heart. If you gained his trust, he would protect you and your family from all perils.
monsters.History: Since 0 AC, the Spectral Lion has been the Spectral Familiar of the Narasimha bloodline. Keepers of the Spectral Lion almost always rise to the highest ranks of the order, adding ever more prestige to their family name. Thus it seems natural that the Keepers of the Spectral Lion are seen as figures of great authority among our order, always taking part in the discussions that concern the Sanctuary as a whole. The prevalent belief among the Keepers of the Lion is that there must be some semblance of law to prevent evil from corrupting the Sanctuary.

monsters.Name: Spectral Toad
monsters.Bio: In the Old World, the Spectral Toad was regarded as the wisest and most generous of the Familiars. He was revered in the lands near the mighty rivers and in the coastal areas. There is debate whether the Spectral Toad is the same Toad that had been worshipped by practitioners of witchcraft since the beginning of time. The Warlock's Toad, as it is sometimes called, was associated with the misty swamps and the mysterious, forlorn places within the deepest reaches of the wilds where humans fear to tread. Finding the Warlock's Toad was said to be a perilous journey, but one which might reward the aspiring wizard with arcane secrets.
monsters.History: Since 0 AC, the Spectral Toad has been the Spectral Familiar of the Heqet bloodline. The Toad is said to often serve as a teacher to young Keepers, even outside their own bloodline. Keepers of the Spectral Toad are said to be the most knowledgeable in whatever field they study, occasionally exhibiting remarkable powers of recollection. Some Keepers of the Toad have used their special knowledge to gain extensive resources and wealth, but it is written that they were always happy to share their riches with their family and friends.

monsters.Name: Spectral Wolf
monsters.Bio: In tales from the Old World, the Spectral Wolf is described as the most cunning of the Familiars and he was said to be the guardian patron of the snowy mountains and dark forests. As with all the other Spectral Familiars, Wolf was revered and respected too, but his relation to the people of the Old World seems more complicated. The dark forests of the Wolf were feared and avoided, but at the same time, the shamans called on the power of the Wolf to protect the newborns from warlocks and other dark influences.
monsters.History: Since the creation of the Monster Sanctuary in 0 AC, the Spectral Wolf has been the Spectral Familiar of the Veles bloodline. In modern Sanctuary folklore, the Spectral Wolf is said to be a friend to strangers and those who prefer the company of beasts to the company of men - who would rather stay in the wilds than in the warm halls of the Keepers' Stronghold. Keepers of the Spectral Wolf aren't seen as particularly warm people, but they are respected for their keen judgment. Thanks to their perceptive and logical nature, they are often called upon to decide on matters of dispute among residents of the Monster Sanctuary.

monsters.Name: Spinner
monsters.Bio: Spinners are among the most mysterious Monsters of the Sanctuary. In fact, nothing concrete can be said about their biological nature. Some believe that they are simply spider-like creatures, while others believe that they are supernatural entities born from the shadows. The third theory states that a Spinner is an amalgam of an innumerable number of small spiders that are controlled by a single shadowy hivemind.
monsters.History: Spinners are creatures found only in the Monster Sanctuary. The first recorded sighting was by Keeper Dragoon Diane in 212 AC. In her journal, she wrote that - after travelling in the distant desolate reaches of the Snowy Peaks for several days - she spotted another Keeper who looked exactly like herself. She was so distraught by this experience that she didn't even dare to approach her doppelganger, certain that it was a dreadful omen. Diane's journal was the only thing that was ever found of her.

monsters.Name: Steam Golem
monsters.Bio: These mechanized workers were engineered by mechanics who dabbled in alchemy. The Steam Golems eventually rebelled against their masters and destroyed the factories they were placed in. Although they cannot speak, it seems that they are able to communicate with each other - even across vast distances.
monsters.History: The Steam Golems were brought to the Monster Sanctuary in 278 AC. Promptly, construction began for a workshop with magical tools made to maintain and repair the Golems. Soon after the workshop was constructed, the Golems surprised the Keepers and showed their capacity for autonomous learning when they began to use the tools on themselves. However, surprise turned to shock when the Golems used the tools to replicate themselves and even to construct new mechanical beings. The Keepers lost control of the workshop and efforts have been made ever since to prevent the workshop's Golems from gaining the resources they require to replicate themselves infinitely.

monsters.Name: Stolby
monsters.Bio: Small of body and long of leg, these curious avian apparitions may sometimes be spotted stalking the darker corners of the Sanctuary. Stolbies are always gathering new insights into the other denizens of the Sanctuary as well as materials for their spells. They are extremely knowledgeable in the fields of herbalism and gemology, and apply these skills in battle both by proliferating dreadful toxins among their enemies, and swiftly healing their allies.
monsters.History: Despite their apparent quiet nature, Stolbies were said to be descendants of a demon prince, and were thus driven out of the Old World. It was Monster Keepers who quickly realized that, when approached passively, these creatures were quite eager to take on a professorial role and pass along their extensive knowledge of poisons and medicines. After this discovery, it was quite easy to encourage them to take up residence in the Monster Sanctuary. Still, there remain some people who believe that Stolbies are pursuing some secret, nefarious scheme. Since some of the other Occult-type Monsters of the Sanctuary are also believed to be closely linked to greater demonic entities, it would be wise to keep a watchful eye on the Stolby population of the Sanctuary.

monsters.Name: Sutsune
monsters.Bio: Sutsune are beautiful, elegant and deadly female vulpine demons. According to ancient stories, Sutsune are able to transform into common foxes or young women; only upon closer inspection one might spot some deformities, such as horns hidden underneath the hair or fur. Often, however, it was already too late at that point, since the Sutsune already snuck in close enough to fulfill her nefarious plan. A Sutsune is said to be as likely to kill as she is to enthrall a man's heart so as to subjugate him for her purposes.
monsters.History: Certain tribes of the Old World feared the Sutsune more than any other known Monster, as Sutsune were said to take away young girls who strayed too far from their homes. With promises of power and independence, they would lure them into the hidden subterranean habitats of the Sutsune where fires burn day and night and all is covered in soot. There, the young girls would be transformed into Sutsune. If one considered the conditions that many women of the Old World had to live in, one could say it wasn't such a bad deal - and perhaps the negative views on the Sutsune were based on prejudice rather than fact.

monsters.Name: Sycophantom
monsters.Bio: A mischievous spirit that is believed to be born of an elephant calf that was brought down by human hunters. Now it is doomed to spend eternity in the form of a young elephant, which explains the Sycophantoms' juvenile behavior. It seems that they are determined only to manipulate others for their own personal gain, or to spread evil in the world that was so unkind to them. It's usually not difficult to outwit a Sycophantom however, which means they often end up doing favors for others, while forgetting to follow through with the actual manipulation part afterwards.
monsters.History: The Sycophantoms used to be one of the lesser-known types of spirits, as they were only spotted in a small region of the Old World. This region was known for its prolific ivory trade, which continued even after the Sycophantoms came into being. As the years went on, more and more Sycophantoms were created. They usually work alone, but eventually they realized that they had to put a stop to the hunters who preyed on their living brethren. So one night, all of the Sycophantoms came together for a massive haunt, chasing out the hunters for good.

monsters.Name: Tanuki
monsters.Bio: Tanukis are shapeshifting creatures with a strong connection to nature. They have often been mistaken for large racoons or bears, because they are quite adept at fooling humans. They travel throughout the entire Monster Sanctuary, but you never know if you're looking at a Tanuki, since they rarely show their real form. As a result, some Monster Keepers have become so paranoid that they believe some of the people of Monster Sanctuary are actually Tanukis in disguise.
monsters.History: It's difficult to write about the history of Tanukis, as nobody knows exactly when they came to the Sanctuary. The history of the Tanukis in the Old World is shrouded in mystery as well, as it's impossible to tell which stories are real and which stories are just fables. It almost seemed miraculous when more and more Keepers reported encountering Tanukis in the Sanctuary - many had doubted their existence altogether. Eventually, it became impossible to deny their reality. It seems as if they aren't really concerned about keeping their existence a secret - apparently, they just like tricking and surprising Monster Keepers.

monsters.Name: Targoat
monsters.Bio: Native to the Snowy Peaks, Targoats are known for being defenders of Monsters they are close to, even risking their own lives. They have a thick coat of fur and thick skin, as well as abnormally hard bones - allowing them to take lots of attacks with little injury. They are very prideful of their fur and their bulk, which often leads to them jumping into danger head-on. The oldest Targoat in captivity was recorded at living for 105 years. However, most Targoats don’t die of old age - they usually die defending others.
monsters.History: Targoats are native Monsters of the Sanctuary, possibly evolved from regular goats that were brought from the Old World. Some believe the first Targoat originated when a regular goat that ate nothing but metal scraps got lost in the Monster-infested mountains of the Snowy Peaks. They are rather rare Monsters since they dwell in areas that are harder to access. Still, Keepers have thoroughly studied the species' behavior, noting the general selflessness and protective nature of Targoats, and they are valued as great companions to Monster Keepers who traverse dangerous areas.

monsters.Name: Tengu
monsters.Bio: Mischievous creatures that seem to only have a single redeeming quality: their love for dance and song. However, they only approach a human when they wish to play a childish prank on them or impress them with their magical powers. It is known that you should always entertain a Tengu's japes and never do anything to infuriate them - unless you want to test the Tengu's mastery of fire and poison.
monsters.History: For many years, the Monster Keepers tried to reason with the Tengus and motivate them to come to the Sanctuary. Significant advances had been made in science and technology and the humans no longer feared the mischievous spirits of the mountains and woods. It was inevitable that the Tengus' pranks would soon cause the humans to retaliate in force. However, the Tengus proved arrogant and even became volatile when the Keepers pushed them on this subject. This only changed when the young, but wise Keeper Ranger Gakuto was put to the task in 17 AC. He deceived the Tengus, played tricks on them and even hired actors for his schemes. Within a single year, he managed to bring all of the Tengus of the wild to the Sanctuary without conflict.

monsters.Name: Thanatos
monsters.Bio: Thanatoi are believed to be demonic entities that come to our world to steal the souls of humans. They are often credited as being the source of the Grim Reaper myth. However, whereas the Grim Reaper is said to bear a grisly, but impartial undead visage, those who look a Thanatos in the face are greeted to an eerie face of a smiling clown. The only way to return the souls a Thanatos stole is by defeating it.
monsters.History: Hundreds of years ago, there lived a king with his royal court in a majestic castle. One by one, the people living in that castle started dying under mysterious circumstances. At first, only servants and knights fell victim to this phenomenon. When it happened to close relatives of the king, panic took hold of the court. Many great warriors were summoned, patrolling the castle at all times. However, each of them lost their lives. After many weeks, an old priest came to the castle, feeble and barely able to walk. Thanks to divine magic, she hunted down the Thanatos that was responsible and banished it from our world, returning all of its victims to life.

monsters.Name: Thornish
monsters.Bio: Some would say that the best defense is a good offense - but for the Thornish, the opposite is closer to the truth. They possess several defense mechanisms that severely harm those who'd try attacking a Thornish: sharp spines which can inflict deep wounds, a set of razor fangs, a particularly vengeful and ruthless disposition that kicks in at the slightest push, and - last but not least - the most poisonous substance on this world, which is prevalent in almost every single cell and organ of the Thornish.
monsters.History: It is believed that Thornish are related to Brawlish in some way. The theory goes that there was an off-branch of Brawlish which lived in the ocean depths and didn't have any islands closeby to retreat to. Despite their strong arms, they were vulnerable to the other Monsters of the ocean that could swim faster and more efficiently. So they developed a complex set of defense mechanisms to fight off just about any form of attack. In fact, they ended up becoming some of the most dangerous predators of the oceans themselves, thanks to their ability to goad other Monsters into attacking them.

monsters.Name: Toxiquus
monsters.Bio: The Toxiquus was first found in polluted areas of the ocean. They travel close to the water surface as well as the deep waters, collecting toxic waste and the poison of other predators alike. They store it within a toxin sac in their belly to use these hazardous substances for their own purposes at a later time. That is not the only peculiar purpose that the Toxiquus's large belly serves, as they may also suck in large quantities of air to propel themselves above the water and hover. Last but not least, the males of this species also carry and hatch eggs within a pouch hidden in their belly.
monsters.History: The Toxiqui are a relatively new addition to the Sanctuary, having been introduced to the Sanctuary in 457 AC. It is believed that they only came into being a few years prior to that date. Soon after they were discovered, they terrorized the seafaring industry and the coastlines of the Old World. In less than a second, a Toxiquus might rise out of the unseen depths of the water and spew slime at a careless beachgoer who had thrown trash in the water.

monsters.Name: Troll
monsters.Bio: Trolls are infamous cave dwellers and gluttons. They will eat almost anything and are often painted as abhorrent scavengers. Their main diet, however, consists of rocks that are rich in minerals. Trolls will quite literally eat their way through the earth in search of such rocks. Due to spending most of their lives underground, they abhor nothing more than sunlight.
monsters.History: The only thing that is known about the origin of Trolls is that there is some unnatural element to them. Some grisly tales state that Trolls are humans who got lost in the woods and became so hungry that they started to eat dirt. Due to their bad reputation, they were almost hunted to extinction in the Old World. Even among Monster Keepers, Trolls were long attributed a lower priority than other Monsters. It was perhaps only thanks to Elendel, the Troll Keeper, that Trolls avoided extinction. He discovered that Trolls provided an important part to their ecosystem thanks to their mineral-rich excrement, which is now known as "Elendel's Gold". In fact, the trees of the Ancient Woods have grown even larger after the Trolls have made the deep tunnels underneath their new home.

monsters.Name: Ucan
monsters.Bio: Ucans are giant hostile crab-like Monsters that possess a few peculiar traits. Their thick, unruly fur mainly serves the purposes of heat insulation and protection against the elements, allowing them to adapt to all types of different environments. Their ancient fossils can be found all across the world, including the snowy arctic and the vast blazing deserts. Their exoskeletons are extremely tough, but they don't grow with their wearers - meaning a Ucan has to shed its exoskeleton several times in its life and grow a new one each time.
monsters.History: It is believed that Ucans were bio-engineered millions of years ago by the otherworldly Elderjels - as is written in the ancient tome of demons, Ahrimaaya. They served as workers and gatherers, sent out to all corners of the Earth to collect rare minerals that the Elderjels required. The Ucans thus laid the foundation of the mighty ancient Elderjel empire. However, when the Ucans were ordered to attack their fellow ocean Monsters, they were the first of the Elderjels' minions to rebel against their masters. Despite eons of servitude, they remained true to their original nature and so it is known that Ucans owe their allegiance only to the ocean itself.

monsters.Name: Vaero
monsters.Bio: Their appearance vaguely resembles a blue jay, although they are much larger and heavier. A Vaero in its prime rivals any bird of prey's size and they can constantly beat their wings for several days without getting tired. However, it is their immense strength and their aptitude for magic that classify them as Monsters - something that the regular hunter or animal wrangler is unequipped to handle.
monsters.History: Despite the Vaeros' considerable size, the people of the Old World often mistook it for a regular bird, trying to hunt it down. Those hunters were swiftly met with strong blows and deadly Feather Storms. Everyone in their village would thereafter know the difference between a bird and a Vaero. There was only a single falconer in history who was known to tame and train a Vaero to follow his commands without the use of magic. The name of this falconer was Falco and he used his companion to hunt down vicious criminals and fight for justice. His trusty Vaero stayed by his side until he died of old age, many years before the Sanctuary was formed. The Vaero then flew back to the wilds where it might've lived for another century or so.

monsters.Name: Vasuki
monsters.Bio: A large snake with two heads that act independently of each other. Observing a Vasuki's heads often teaches one a good lesson about the importance of cooperation - for a Vasuki is most deadly when it strikes at the same foe with both heads at once.
monsters.History: There once lived a pair of twin princes. When it came to the matter of succession, their father decided that both deserved to rule as kings. So the kingdom was separated in two and each one of the twins was crowned king over one half of the kingdom. Unfortunately, they both desired to reign over the entire kingdom, and so they fought a bloody war against each other. The final fight of that war was so brutal that not a single soldier was left alive to tell the tale. The bodies of the royal twins were never recovered from the battlefield, but a large two-headed snake was seen slithering away from it. According to the story, it was the reincarnation of the royal twins, cursed by the gods to share the same body for their next live. They learned from their mistakes and ruled together as kings over the animal kingdom.

monsters.Name: Vertraag
monsters.Bio: Vertraag is the name of a powerful god of time, although the Vertraag that some Monster Keepers claim to have encountered was perhaps just an avatar of Vertraag that has manifested in our world for unknown reasons. Vertraag is said to be a deity who's always scheming and working to fulfill some millenia-spanning plan, no mere mortal possibly being able to discern his end goals.
monsters.History: Manifestations of Vertraag have appeared to several important people in the history of our world, as well as to some Monster Keepers of particular renown. For instance, each of the four original Spectral Keepers was independently visited by Vertraag on the same day, at the exact same time. Each was given a clue that, when put together, told them that they needed to go to the Tree of Evolution in order to unleash the power of their Spectral Familiars, which led to the creation of the Monster Sanctuary.

monsters.Name: Vodinoy
monsters.Bio: Vodinoy are fierce, resilient mermen that can sometimes be found in ponds and rivers near villages, although their home is said to lie in the deepest ocean depths, where no human has ever been.
monsters.History: Although the true origin of Vodinoys is unknown, there are many stories of people living in remote fishing villages that turned into Vodinoys. The signs would first show when a young man approached adulthood. He would begin to dream of a majestic underwater city where he would be free of the trials and tribulations of everyday life. Next, the body would gradually change, taking on fish-like features, which causes much horror, grief and shame to the affected one's family. Later on, the affected one would lose the ability to communicate with others, as they start to talk in a strange, croak-like language that only other Vodinoys understand. Lastly, they would vanish in the nearby waters to chase their dreams of a paradise hidden underwater in the vast oceans. Still, Vodinoys can sometimes be seen nearby villages, often wearing old, patchy clothes - a futile attempt to return to their original homes.

monsters.Name: Worm
monsters.Bio: Three inches tall and armed to the teeth, Worms are likely one of the most peculiar and puzzling Monster species. Worms live in strictly separated groups, which are at war with each other at virtually all times. They carry out these wars with highly advanced weaponry, some of which resembles miniature versions of weapons that have been developed in the Old World. Some of their weapons, however, do not resemble anything a human mind would ever engineer.
monsters.History: There exist certain closed-off areas in the Monster Sanctuary - most of them in desolate or underground places - where the small Worms carry out their wars. Due to their small size, they're often not counted among Monster species. There exist, however, many rumors that Worms have been sighted that were at the size of regular Monsters. There are different theories, but the most popular theory seems to be that it was the Worms themselves which have found a way to super-size their own. If so, the fact that they only chose to super-size the soldiers of their species can only mean that they wish to declare war on the other Monsters of the Sanctuary.

monsters.Name: Yowie
monsters.Bio: The Yowies used to avoid humans at all costs, going to great lengths not to show themselves. However, ever since they were brought to the Sanctuary, they have become more jovial as well as battlesome, happily taking challenges from starting Monster Keepers. The Yowie is speculated to be a distant relative of humans.
monsters.History: The Yowie was long thought to be just a myth. Many people collected footprints of this elusive beast, but they often varied in size and number of toes. Even the early Monster Keepers weren't sure of their existence, and it was complete happenstance that a Monster Keeper came upon a Yowie. In 97 AC, while traversing a desolate, icy mountainside in search of a village of Mogwais, Keeper Ranger Rianna was surprised by a relentless snowstorm. She found shelter in a nearby cave, where she met a Yowie mother and her infants. The Keeper Ranger showed the Yowie that she didn't mean harm and in turn was taught the ways of the Yowie. She convinced the Yowie mother to come to the Sanctuary and thereafter managed to find a great number of other Yowies that lived in the mountains and forests of that land.

champions.Name: Champion
champions.Description: Increases Health, Damage and Mana Regeneration. Monster can act multiple times.
